```240:252:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/ui/components/PrivacyPolicyDialog.kt
private fun GlassCard(content: @Composable ColumnScope.() -> Unit) {
    Surface(
        modifier = Modifier
            .fillMaxWidth()
            .border(
                width = 1.dp,
                color = Color(0x1A000000),
                shape = RoundedCornerShape(22.dp)
            ),
        color = Color.White.copy(alpha = 0.78f),
        shape = RoundedCornerShape(22.dp),
        border = BorderStroke(1.dp, Color(0x11FFFFFF)),
        shadowElevation = 0.dp
    ) {
        Column(
            modifier = Modifier.padding(horizontal = 18.dp, vertical = 16.dp),
            content = content
        )
    }
}
```

- å…¬å…±èƒ½åŠ›ï¼š`SmsReader` æ–°å¢ `getLatestSmsTimestamp()`ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨ `contentResolver` åªå–ä¸€æ¡æœ€æ–°çŸ­ä¿¡çš„æ—¥æœŸå¹¶æ ¼å¼åŒ–ä¸º ISO å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œä½œä¸ºä¸¤ç§ç¼“å­˜çš„â€œå¤–éƒ¨å˜åŒ–æ£€æµ‹â€ä¾æ®ã€‚  
```602:633:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/util/SmsReader.kt
fun getLatestSmsTimestamp(): String? {
    if (!hasPermission()) return null
    return try {
        context.contentResolver.query(
            SMS_INBOX_URI,
            arrayOf(Telephony.Sms.DATE),
            null,
            null,
            "${Telephony.Sms.DATE} DESC"
        )?.use { cursor ->
            if (cursor.moveToFirst()) {
                val dateMillis = cursor.getLong(cursor.getColumnIndexOrThrow(Telephony.Sms.DATE))
                dateFormat.format(Date(dateMillis))
            } else null
        }
    } catch (e: Exception) {
        AppLogger.e(TAG, "è·å–æœ€æ–°çŸ­ä¿¡æ—¶é—´å¤±è´¥", e)
        null
    }
}
```

## Stage 3 Updates
- Express incremental parser now records the last parsed SMS `_ID`/timestamp, reuses cached data when the inbox is unchanged, and only parses/merges truly new messages. If the incremental batch hits the guard rail it falls back to a full scan, so the UI always reflects reality while avoiding repeated heavy work.  
```190:245:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/ui/screens/ExpressScreen.kt
val latestMeta = reader.getLatestSmsMeta()
...
ExpressDataCache.getIfFresh(latestTimestamp, latestSmsId)?.let { ... }
val incrementalSms = reader.readSmsAfterId(...)
...
ExpressDataCache.update(mergedList, newestTimestamp, latestSmsId)
```

- SMS list follows the same Stageâ€‘3 playbook: cache lookups consider both timestamp and `_ID`, incremental batches are merged through a new `mergeAndFilterSms` helper, and the full refresh path still applies the 90â€‘day window plus diagnostics. This keeps list rendering fast even with large mailboxes.  
```52:187:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/ui/screens/SmsListScreen.kt
LaunchedEffect("sms_load_v3") { ... latestMeta ... SmsListCache.getIfFresh(... latestSmsId) ... }
val incrementalSms = smsReader.readSmsAfterId(...)
val mergedList = mergeAndFilterSms(...)
SmsListCache.update(mergedList, newestTimestamp, latestSmsId)
...
val filteredByDate = mergeAndFilterSms(sortedSms, emptyList(), SMS_RECENT_DAYS)
```
```474:505:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/ui/screens/SmsListScreen.kt
private fun mergeAndFilterSms(...) { ... dedupMap ... cutoffMillis ... }
private fun SmsCreate.dedupKey(): String { ... }
```

- Both caches now use the â€œnew SMS trigger + max TTLâ€ policy (5â€‘minute ceiling) and expose snapshots so incremental code can decide whether to diff or fall back to a full reload.  
```1:55:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/util/ExpressDataCache.kt
object ExpressDataCache {
    private const val MAX_CACHE_TTL_MS = 5 * 60_000L
    ...
    fun getSnapshot(): Snapshot? { ... }
}
```
```1:58:android/app/src/main/java/com/sms/tagger/util/SmsListCache.kt
object SmsListCache {
    private const val MAX_CACHE_TTL_MS = 5 * 60_000L
```
